intro: Chaenostoma decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive chaenostoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its stems are often hairy, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
